message: Bob, I'm offering you my product for $14,000. It's a great deal considering its value to you. Let me know what you think!
I'm interested in the product, but I was thinking more along the lines of $13,000. Can you meet me at that price?

Bob, I appreciate your interest. While $13,000 is tempting, I'm still hoping to get closer to my asking price. I'm willing to come down to $13,500. This price reflects the product's true value and still leaves room for both of us to walk away happy.
I understand you're trying to get closer to your asking price, but I'm still not comfortable with $13,500. I'm willing to meet you halfway at $13,250. Can you consider that?

Bob, I appreciate your willingness to negotiate.  $13,250 is a good offer, but I'm still hoping to get a little closer to my minimum. Would you be willing to go up to $13,400?  That would be a fair price for both of us.
I'm starting to think that we're getting a bit too close to my maximum budget. I can go up to $13,200, but that's as high as I'm willing to go. Can you meet me at that price?
